intro: Herpestis rugosa, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands. Its leaves are characterized by their rough texture and serrated edges, while its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters. Herpestis rugosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun.
